message.content:
cs.GT, cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.EC

The paper deals with designing a mechanism for purchasing data from strategic agents to compute an unbiased estimate of a statistic of interest. This involves game-theoretic considerations, making cs.GT (Game Theory and Economics) the most likely sub-category. The paper also focuses on linear unbiased estimators, which falls under cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). The mechanism is designed to optimize the worst-case mean-squared error of the estimation, which involves information theory and optimization, making cs.IT (Information Theory) a likely sub-category. Finally, the paper extends its results to acquiring data for estimating a parameter in regression analysis, which falls under cs.EC (Computational Economics and Finance).
